H0.text: Products are the other component involved in all chemical reactions alongside reactants.

H1.text: Consumers are the other component involved in all chemical reactions, along with reactants.

H2.text: Catalysts are the other component involved in all chemical reactions alongside reactants.

H3.text: Energy is involved in all chemical reactions along with reactants.

A4.text: Chemical reactions are usually characterized by a chemical change, and they yield one or more products, which usually have properties different from the reactants.

A5.text: When chemical reactions occur, the atoms are rearranged and the reaction is accompanied by an energy change as new products are generated.

A6.text: Catalysts are substances that make weak bonds with reactants or intermediates and change the pathway (mechanism) of a reaction which in turn increases the speed of a reaction by lowering the activation energy needed for the reaction to take place.

A7.text: Reactions can proceed by themselves if they are exergonic, that is if they release free energy.
